result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Retain Possession (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danny Rodriguez in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State.  Case passed.

CASE RECALLED.  SAME APPEARANCES.
TAPE# 11:25

Sentencing continued.  Statements by defense and defendant.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 8 days served; Huber privileges for work and continued treatment; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING; sentence to commence on November 2, 2015 by 5:00pm.  

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 12-28-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny Rodriguez in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM042120  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09-13-2015
$25.00 on deposit to remain.  Defendant to post another $75.00.  All conditions remain the same.

Defendant Danny Rodriguez in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner who appeared via telephone.  Defendant Danny Rodriguez in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 24.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Court in receipt of violation report from Justice Point.  Defendant had positive drug tests.  Argument heard as to bail.  Court ordered cash bail set at $100.00.

Defendant Danny Rodriguez in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussions of Justice Point Report placed on the record. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM037128  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/09/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Defendant Danny Rodriguez in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Danny Rodriguez in custody.  
Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Remand to commissioner

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant, remand to commissioner.  Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BOSTON STORE, 533 S 76TH ST. AND CRYSTAL H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Danny Rodriguez in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Danny Rodriguez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
